summary: The 2007-09 financial crisis resulted in millions of foreclosures and demographic changes—making renter households more common. We looked at declining rent affordability since then, but before COVID-19. Rent burden was most common and most severe among lower-income households, with most of the poorest households paying over half of their income to rent. Affordability has declined because the supply of low-cost rental units hasn’t kept up...
title: Rental Housing: As More Households Rent, the Poorest Face Affordability and Housing Quality Challenges
